DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field relating to the not having diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of the liver, the large organ located in the upper abdomen that cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the not having diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of the liver, the large organ located in the upper abdomen that cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.
